about:
MÃ–BIUS is a 5 days festival about contemporary and experimental theatre, dance and music, promoted by La Triennale di Milano and Piccolo Teatro.

The event was conceived in 2017, to give to the city of Milan an international perspective on the current trends in performing arts, as well as to bring many world-famous artists in the city and create opportunities for emerging artists. Besides the main plays and concerts, that still represent its core, the festival features several lectures, debates and workshops on the many issues of contemporary art, to stimulate a fruitful reflection on the future of the cultural industry and its role in the new modern society.

For this first edition the proposed theme is:
Exploring complexity: emerging patterns from dynamic relations
location_desc: All the events are held in the Triennale Palazzo dell'arte venue.
